decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling combo pieces to mill through the deck, utilizing creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill. This deck aims to win through a quick, explosive combo that overwhelms the opponent before they have a chance to react. The deck also features cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to help tutor for key pieces, while using cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on controlling the game while ramping up mana to quickly play powerful spells like Omnath, Genesis Ultimatum, and Uro. By using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy and Fae of Wishes to access a sideboard full of versatile options, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in the mid to late game. With a combination of efficient ramp, card draw, and removal, the deck can overwhelm opponents with its powerful threats and versatile game plan.

The deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana using cards like Lotus Cobra and Omnath, Locus of Creation to cast powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum and Escape to the Wilds. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the game while Fae of Wishes provides versatility with its ability to fetch cards from the sideboard. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Kenrith, the Returned King provide additional value and win conditions. The deck aims to outpace opponents with its ramp and control elements, overwhelming them with powerful spells and threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing green devotion to ramp up mana and overwhelming opponents with powerful creatures and planeswalkers. By generating a large amount of mana through Nykthos and mana dorks, the deck can cast high-cost threats like Voracious Hydra and Nissa, Who Shakes the World early in the game. Karn, the Great Creator provides disruption and access to powerful artifacts, while Vivien, Arkbow Ranger offers removal and card advantage. The key strategy is to build a massive board presence quickly and close out the game before the opponent can recover.

This deck focuses on quickly milling through your library to get key combo pieces into the graveyard and onto the battlefield. By utilizing creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, you can put cards like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam onto the battlefield for free. With cards like Creeping Chill and Silversmote Ghoul, you can drain your opponent's life total quickly. The deck also includes a wide range of cards that allow you to search for specific combo pieces or recover them from your graveyard.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through cards like Narset and Teferi while using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free. The key strategy is to cheat out powerful threats like Agent of Treachery or a giant Shark Typhoon by using Lukka or Transmogrify to exchange a small token for a game-changing creature. The deck also utilizes sweepers like Deafening Clarion and Supreme Verdict to handle opposing creatures and generate value from cards like Omen of the Sea and Omen of the Sun.

The main focus of this deck is to rapidly build up green devotion and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful planeswalkers. By generating excessive mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, the deck can quickly play out large threats such as Voracious Hydra and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. The inclusion of Burning-Tree Emissary allows for explosive starts, while cards like Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, this deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the opponent's library, triggering creatures like Prized Amalgam and Silversmote Ghoul to return from the graveyard. By combining these creatures with cards like Creeping Chill and Driven / Despair, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. The inclusion of Eldritch Evolution and Neoform allows for quick creature searches and evolution, while cards like Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt the opponent's gameplan. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of explosive creature plays and graveyard recursion.

This deck focuses on utilizing cards like Lotus Cobra, Omnath, Uro, and Escape to the Wilds to ramp up your mana quickly, while also controlling the opponent's board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Felidar Retreat. By generating large amounts of mana and playing powerful spells like Genesis Ultimatum, you can overwhelm your opponent and establish board presence. The inclusion of Kenrith, the Returned King adds versatility and further control elements to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to outpace and outvalue your opponent to secure victories.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a significant amount of mana quickly, allowing for explosive turns and powerful combos. By ramping up with cards like Arboreal Grazer and strategic planning, the deck can set up big plays using hidden strings and other untap effects. Fae of Wishes provides flexibility and access to a sideboard toolbox, while Baral, Chief of Compliance helps reduce the cost of spells. The goal is to dig through the deck for key pieces and control the game until you can assemble a game-winning combo.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly mill through the deck using cards like Undercity Informer and Balustrade Spy, putting cards like Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill into the graveyard. This allows for a powerful combo utilizing Eldritch Evolution to bring out Worldspine Wurm or Haunted Dead. Sea Gate Restoration and Turntimber Symbiosis serve as backup plans to find key combo pieces while black mana sources like Agadeem's Awakening and Hagra Mauling help control the board. The deck relies on rapid graveyard interactions to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces necessary to mill through your deck and get cards like Thassa's Oracle or Jace, Wielder of Mysteries onto the battlefield to win the game. Utilizing a combination of self-mill effects, reanimation spells, and creature tutors, the deck aims to set up a powerful win condition that can take opponents by surprise and secure victory in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 match.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with cheap, aggressive creatures and burn spells in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Ghitu Lavarunner, as well as powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Boros Charm, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion for the deck's low-cost creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to build up a strong devotion to green mana while utilizing aggro strategies to overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Elvish Mystic help ramp up mana, while powerful green planeswalkers like Nissa and Vivien provide additional threats. Cards like Karn, the Great Creator can shut down opponent's artifacts, while Voracious Hydra can be a versatile threat. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence quickly and use its mana efficiently to outpace the opponent.

This control deck focuses on using Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a powerful card advantage engine, supported by a versatile array of gold cards. The deck aims to control the board with a mix of removal spells, creatures, and planeswalkers while ramping into powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The diverse mana base allows for consistent casting of the deck's many gold cards, which are able to answer a wide range of threats and provide the deck with resiliency and flexibility in different matchups.

The primary strategy of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive early game, utilizing efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Legion Warboss, and Goblin Rabblemaster. The deck aims to apply pressure quickly and consistently by utilizing mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to ramp into powerful threats like Glorybringer and Questing Beast. With a focus on tempo and board presence, the deck aims to finish off opponents with powerful combat tricks like Embercleave and Atarka's Command.
